overview: Frederick R. Blume has been active in medically focused venture capital since the mid 1980’s. Prior to forming CB Health Ventures he co-founded Capital Health Management and the American Healthcare Funds. Capital Health managed two funds, initiated by Mr. Blume, that focused on healthcare products and services that lower costs and/or improve outcomes. The 24 investments of the two recent funds, initiated in 1998 and 2001, resulted in 21 successful companies or products with an aggregate market capitalization of several billion dollars. Prior to starting the American Healthcare Funds, Mr. Blume was a Managing Director at PaineWebber- specializing in healthcare corporate finance and a member of Blyth Eastman Dillon’s Healthcare Group.

degrees.institution: Stanford University Graduate School of Business
